TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SoapBindingUse extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the message parts are encoded as abstract type definitions or concrete schema definitions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration applies to extensibility elements which specify that data transmissions use the SOAP protocol, and which are added to <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.FaultBinding>, <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.InputBinding> and <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OutputBinding> instances.
For more information about specifying protocols for XML Web services, see [[\<topic://cpconbuildingaspnetwebservices>]](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01dfc27c-c68e-4910-a0aa-5e4c2a766b0c). For more information about Web Services Description Language (WSDL), see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
## Examples [!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Description.SoapBindingUse Default = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Specifies an empty string ("") value for the corresponding XML attribute.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Description.SoapBindingUse Encoded = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The message parts are encoded using given encoding rules.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Description.SoapBindingUse Literal = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The message parts represent a concrete schema.
